conclusion: The task is to determine which blocks the car will collide with and where it will eventually stop based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
There are blocks of different colors arranged on a green surface, and a toy car is being driven into the scene from the lower right area.

Yellow blocks are on the left side, blue blocks are slightly to the right of the yellow ones, green blocks are further to the right, orange blocks are arranged in a line towards the bottom left, and red blocks are clustered near the bottom right.
The car is entering from the lower right corner, as indicated by the arrow labeled 'A,' moving towards the left side of the frame.
The red blocks are closest to the car's entry point and will likely be the first point of contact.
When the car hits the red blocks, it might move them, knock them over, or be deflected depending on the material and shape of the blocks.
Assuming the red blocks are solid and stationary, the car will be deflected by the collision, with the direction of deflection depending on the angle of impact and the position of the blocks.
